private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels.
Vowel blocks in this instance are A, I, and E.
I can only pick the top block of any stack and move one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, and K is on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants.
Consonant blocks in this instance are D, F, G, B, J, C, H, and K.
I can only pick the top block of any stack and move one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, and K is on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two specialized agents and integrate their observations and proposals.
I must produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward.
I must keep the actions of the two agents distinct in the PDDL domain.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global stacking goal using coordinated actions of the vowel and consonant agents.

public_information: There are eleven labeled blocks: A, D, I, F, G, B, J, C, H, K, E.
Blocks that are initially on the table are A, D, and F.
Initial stack relationships are as follows: I is on top of D, G is on top of I, B is on top of G, C is on top of B, H is on top of C, K is on top of J, E is on top of K, and J is on top of F.
Only the top block of any stack can be moved at any time.
Each agent can manipulate only one block at a time.
One agent can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks and the other only consonant-labeled blocks.
The target goal is a single long stack with A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, and K on the table.
initial_configuration: I is on top of D
G is on top of I
B is on top of G
J is on top of F
C is on top of B
H is on top of C
K is on top of J
E is on top of K
goal_configuration: A is on top of B
B is on top of C
C is on top of D
D is on top of E
E is on top of F
F is on top of G
G is on top of H
H is on top of I
I is on top of J
J is on top of K

report.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks. You may pick only the top block of any visible stack and move exactly one block at a time. Do not emit PDDL. Describe your local capabilities, list which of the initial top blocks you can move immediately, and propose a sequence of high level moves restricted to vowel blocks that contributes toward the global goal. Identify any constraints or potential deadlocks that require coordination with the consonant agent.
report.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You operate in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} This is the global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal} Provide a concise local report. Include the set of moves you can perform immediately given the initial configuration and the top only restriction, and a short prioritized list of suggested moves using only vowel blocks to help achieve the goal. Do not output PDDL.

report.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks. You may pick only the top block of any visible stack and move exactly one block at a time. Do not emit PDDL. Describe your local capabilities, list which of the initial top blocks you can move immediately, and propose a sequence of high level moves restricted to consonant blocks that contributes toward the global goal. Identify any constraints or potential deadlocks that require coordination with the vowel agent.
report.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You operate in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} This is the global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal} Provide a concise local report. Include the set of moves you can perform immediately given the initial configuration and the top only restriction, and a short prioritized list of suggested moves using only consonant blocks to help achieve the goal. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Your task is to integrate the local reports from the vowel and consonant agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem that is compatible with the FastDownward planner. Keep the actions of the two agents distinct. Use clear action names that indicate which agent performs them. The domain must encode the top-only and single-block manipulation constraints and the agent-specific label restrictions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Target FastDownward compatibility.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Here is the public environment information: {environment->public_information} Here is the initial configuration: {environment->initial_configuration} Here is the goal configuration: {environment->goal_configuration} Here is the vowel agent report: {vowel_agent_report} Here is the consonant agent report: {consonant_agent_report} Integrate the information and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieves the global goal. Keep actions belonging to vowel manipulations distinct from consonant manipulations. Ensure the PDDL is suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem>.
